info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 12:56AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact western to northern portions of Luzerne County through 130 AM EDT... At 1254 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Muhlenberg, or 9 miles west of Wilkes-Barre, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Muhlenberg, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Old Forge, Pittston, Plymouth, Moosic and Exeter. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 164 and 178A and B. Interstate 476 near 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this cluster of storms and may lead to localized street flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This can be especially hard to recognize at night. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
